snippet: After aggressive campaigns that involved a parade of elephants and a Heisman Trophy-winning quarterback, Cleveland beat Dallas for the right to host the 2016 Republican convention.
abstract: Cleveland is chosen as site of 2016 Republican National Convention, pending ratification by the full Republican National Committee in August; Republican committee staff says choice is business decision based on finances, but Republicans are aware that no Republican has won the presidency without carrying Ohio.

byline.original: By TRIP GABRIEL and JONATHAN MARTIN

lead_paragraph: After aggressive campaigns that involved a parade of elephants and a Heisman Trophy-winning quarterback, Cleveland beat Dallas for the right to host the 2016 Republican convention.

headline.main: Republicans Pick Cleveland Over Dallas for Convention
headline.print_headline: Republicans Pick Cleveland Over Dallas for Convention
